Name: Head of statuette
Description: This fragment of statue was acquired by a exchange with the Museum of Cairo in 1907. It is very difficult to discern the identity of the person represented. A single element is important: the head is wearing the red crown of the Delta, which is presented as a sort of mortar of which the back part (here partially disappeared) rises vertically and in which a stalk is fixed, terminating in a spiral. Noticing the feminine facial features, it is very probable that the statuette represents the goddess Neith of Sais.
